info.title: User Roles And Permissions
info.description:
## TMF API Reference : TMF 672 - User Roles And Permissions

This API is used to manage the user account with which the customer or staff can log-in and log-off the system and the permission for the user to enter or operate the special information.

get.description: This operation list or find Permission entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a Permission entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a Permission entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

patch.description: This operation updates partially a Permission entity.

parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

AssetUserRole.description: The AssetUserRole is the detailed information concerning an individual user role

Entitlement.description: An Entitlement defines access levels to operate over a given function that can be included in an asset.

action.description: Level of access granted as part of the permission.

Permission.description: The Permission resource represents the entitlement given by an individual (granter) to another individual (user) to get access to a set of his owned manageable assets. One single permission resource can hold information referring to privileges granted for multiple manageable assets.

creationDate.description: Date when the payment was performed

description.description: Text describing the contents of the payment

validFor.description: The period for which the permission is valid

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

Permission_Create.description:
The Permission resource represents the entitlement given by an individual (granter) to another individual (user) to get access to a set of his owned manageable assets. One single permission resource can hold information referring to privileges granted for multiple manageable assets.
Skipped properties: id,href,creationDate

description.description: Text describing the contents of the payment

validFor.description: The period for which the permission is valid

TimePeriod.description: A period of time, either as a deadline (endDateTime only) a startDateTime only, or both

endDateTime.description: End of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

startDateTime.description: Start of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format. If you define a start, you must also define an end

UserRole.description: A UserRole defines access levels to operate over a given function that can be included in an asset.

href.description: Unique URI used to access to the userRole resource

involvementRole.description: Indication of the part that a user plays in its involvement with a manageable asset (product, service or resource)

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.
